author: Zubeda Hamid
text:
For the first time, over 1,000 people afflicted by leprosy have been registered to vote in the upcoming Assembly election, said C. Manimaran, nodal officer of the State Commission for the Differently Abled, at the chief electoral office.

“We set up booths at 10 homes for people afflicted by leprosy across the State and have registered 1,131 voters. They have all been given voter ID cards,” he said.

This apart, the office of the chief electoral officer was also working with registered NGOs running homes for persons with disabilities to register more residents, he said. “We are also working on making polling stations accessible to all. Apart from setting up temporary ramps, all district officers have been asked to get a team of volunteers to help residents with wheelchairs at the polling stations if required. Entrances are being made accessible and all polling stations will be on ground floors,” he said.

Support is also being extended to the Disability Rights Alliance, Tamil Nadu, which is access auditing the polling stations, he said.
title: Over 1,000 residents with leprosy registered to vote
